title: A New Glass House on Miami Beach’s Hibiscus Island
text:
Listing of the Day

Location: Hibiscus Island, Miami Beach, Florida

Price: $16.75 million

This newly built and furnished home on Hibiscus Island, a man-made and gated island in Miami’s Biscayne Bay, offers an infinity-edge pool, a guest apartment above the garage and an elevator to a rooftop terrace.

"It’s a modern house, but it has a different look," listing agent Albert Justo said. "It’s kind of like a floating house—it’s all glass."

It is also elevated, "built about 12 feet above sea level, so you get nice breezes," he said.

More: Coconut Grove, a Miami Neighborhood That Feels Like a ‘Small Town With a Big-City Vibe’

With modern houses, "we’re seeing buyers who want a warmer feel with more wood and wallpaper, away from the industrial look," Mr. Justo said. And this house has that.

Except for some of the artwork, most of the furnishings, which were custom designed by Minotti and B&B Italia, are included, he said.

Architectural and design features include an open floor plan, a 20-foot-tall all-glass foyer, an atrium separating the foyer from the kitchen, a floating staircase to the roof, and pocket doors in the living room that open up completely.

The previous house on the property had "very lush gardens, almost like a jungle," and the owner, a local builder/developer, wanted to preserve that look, Mr. Justo said.

The owner was very involved with the building and design process, Mr. Justo said. "He was there every day."

More: Miami Property Prices Have Been Rising Nonstop for More Than Seven Years

The custom Arclinea kitchen with Miele appliances opens to the living room, which spans the whole side of the house, he said. "You get beautiful panoramic views from the living room."

The master suite, which has a sitting area with a full sofa, offers views of the water and downtown lights, Mr. Justo said. "You get 360-degree views from the roof."

The house offers a lot of privacy because of the lush gardens, he added.

Stats

The 7,000-square-foot house has five bedrooms, five full bathrooms and one partial bathroom. It sits on a 12,221-square-foot lot.

Amenities

Amenities include an infinity-edge swimming pool, a glass-lined elevator, a private entry garden, a rooftop terrace, and a two-car garage with an upstairs studio apartment, with a full kitchen, for guests.

Hibiscus Island amenities include access to tennis and basketball courts and a private playground.

From Penta: Objects of British and European Royal Provenance to Be Auctioned at Christie’s

Neighborhood Notes

Hibiscus Island is "perfectly in the middle" between South Beach and the Brickell downtown area, Mr. Justo said. "There is a nice sense of community on the island."

"You’re very close to the ocean and South of Fifth," the highly desirable southern end of Miami Beach, he said.

Agents: Albert Justo and Mirce Curkoski, the Waterfront Team of ONE Sotheby’s International Realty
